com.sencha.gxt.widget.core.client.grid.filters
Class Filter<M,V>

java.lang.Object
  com.sencha.gxt.widget.core.client.grid.filters.Filter<M,V>
Type Parameters:
M - the model type
V - the filter type
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActivateEvent.HasActivateHandlers<Filter<M,?>>, DeactivateEvent.HasDeactivateHandlers<Filter<M,?>>, UpdateEvent.HasUpdateHandlers
Direct Known Subclasses:
BooleanFilter, DateFilter, ListFilter, NumericFilter, StringFilter
public abstract class Filter<M,V>
extends Object
implements UpdateEvent.HasUpdateHandlers, ActivateEvent.HasActivateHandlers<Filter<M,?>>, DeactivateEvent.HasDeactivateHandlers<Filter<M,?>>

Provides an abstract base class for filters. A filter is applied to an object such as a Grid to reduce the amount of information that is displayed, thus highlighting the information of interest to the user. A filter is generally invoked from a header menu.

Derived classes provide type-specific filter support (e.g. string, number, date, boolean, etc.) and must implement getFilterConfig(), getValue() and getType().

To add a filter to a Grid column, create an instance of a concrete subclass of Filter, passing to the constructor the ValueProvider for the column, then add the filter to a GridFilters using AbstractGridFilters.addFilter(Filter) and invoke AbstractGridFilters.initPlugin(Grid). The filter then appears in the grid header menu item for any column that uses the supplied value provider.

Constructor Detail

Filter

public Filter(ValueProvider<? super M,V> valueProvider)
Creates a filter for the specified value provider. When used with GridFilters, the filter appears in the grid header menu item for any column that uses the supplied value provider.

Parameters:
valueProvider - the value provider that implements the interface to the data model associated with this filter.

getFilterConfig

public abstract List<FilterConfig> getFilterConfig()
Returns a list of filter configurations. Note that a filter may consist of multiple criteria (e.g. "date after" and "date before"). There is a filter configuration for each of these criteria.

Returns:
a list of filter configurations

setActive

public void setActive(boolean active,
                      boolean suppressEvent)
Sets the status of the filter and fires the appropriate events. You can only set it to active if the filter is activatable.

Parameters:
active - the new filter state
suppressEvent - true to prevent events from being fired

setHandler

public void setHandler(FilterHandler<V> handler)
Sets the filter handler for this filter. A filter handler is responsible for converting between a String representation of the filter and its native representation.

Parameters:
handler - for converting between String and native representation of <V>.

setUpdateBuffer

public void setUpdateBuffer(int updateBuffer)
Number of milliseconds to wait after user interaction to fire an update (defaults to 500).

Parameters:
updateBuffer - the update buffer in milliseconds
